269.html:
Group creation

    1. User gives a name to the group, in which they wanted to add those enrollers.
    2. In our application ( Enroller )

            If the group is not exist already, we create a new group and add those enrollers to the newly created group.
            If the group is already exist, then we simple add those enrollers to the existing group.
            Both are done automatically, so no need to exiting group name through Special Instruction field.


Shopify App

            First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
            All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
            Enroller App Installation means you are allowing Enroller application to access your Shopify store to add certain functionality.
            So the source code remains hosted in your own server, that's why we need a Linux box with apache server.
            In case if you are not clear about How Shopify App installation works I suggest to go through the official documentation.

   



On Tuesday 02 June 2015 05:36 PM, dineshkumar@cgvakindia.com wrote:
 
Hi Saravanan,

 

The text isn’t quite right on the cart page. 

 

Both the questions – ‘Want to create a learning group’ and ‘Want to add learners to an existing group? Please provide the name of the group in the special instructions section below.’ should be visible when the screen loads then if the check box is ticked to create a group it should display the fields and only request details for a new group.  The name of an existing group is to be put into the special instructions box so that the client receives the information in the ‘confirmation of sale’ email and can manually add users to an existing group.

 

Can you explain why you need the linux box and SMTP credentials?  My understanding is that the Shopify app has to be hosted in the Shopify App Store as a private app to be used by our clients website, is that not the case?

 

Thanks

 

Regards

Dinesh D

 


--

279.html:
Hi,

You can override the rendering behaviour of bundles using hooks. but I am still preparing the documentation, I will publish it soon and let you know.


Regards
Sark

--
Just downloaded the bundle plugin. Works great but how do I edit how the bundle shows up on the front-end (the bundle product page)? I can't seem to find a file for that in the plugin docs! Thanks,

280.html:
Removing.? you mean hiding the price right,?.

you can do that using 'woocommerce_get_price_html' hook ( there is no option from the plugin ).

in your 'functions.php' do something like this.

function hide_bundle_price( $price, $product ) {
    if( $product->get_title() == 'You Product Title' ) {
        return "";
    }
    return $price;
}
add_filter( 'woocommerce_get_price_html', 'hide_bundle_price', 2, 10 );


regards
Sark

282.html:
Try this

function hide_bundle_price( $price, $product ) {   
        $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
        $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
        if( $product_type == "wcpb" ) {   
            return "";   
        }   
        return $price;   
}   
add_filter( 'woocommerce_get_price_html', 'hide_bundle_price', 2, 10 );

and one more thing, why you want to hide the price.
If some body really want to hide than I can include that as an option, that's why I am asking.


Regards
Sark

283.html:
Use the following hooks

function add_extra_link_on_single() {
    global $product;
    $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
    $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
    if( $product_type == "simple" ) {
        echo '<a href="domain.com">Visit Site</a>';
    }
}
add_action( 'woocommerce_before_add_to_cart_button', 'add_extra_link_on_single' );

function add_extra_link_on_archive( $html, $product ) {
    $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
    $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
    if( $product_type == "simple" ) {
        return '<a href="domain.com">Visit Site</a>'.$html;
    }
    return $html;
}
add_action( 'woocommerce_loop_add_to_cart_link', 'add_extra_link_on_archive' );


Yes, I am a full time programmer and freelancer, here is my profile. Sure I would like to work with any Wordpress, Woocommerce or Shopify related works.


Regards
Sark

284.html:
Try this,

function add_extra_link_on_single() {
    global $product;
    $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
    $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
    if( $product_type == "simple" ) {
        echo '<a href="'. fetchUrl( get_post( $product->id )->post_content ) .'">Visit Site</a>';
    }
}
add_action( 'woocommerce_before_add_to_cart_button', 'add_extra_link_on_single' );

function add_extra_link_on_archive( $html, $product ) {
    $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
    $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
    if( $product_type == "simple" ) {
        return '<a href="'. fetchUrl( get_post( $product->id )->post_content ) .'">Visit Site</a>'.$html;
    }
    return $html;
}
add_action( 'woocommerce_loop_add_to_cart_link', 'add_extra_link_on_archive', 10, 2 );

/* Fetch first occurance of any url */
function fetchUrl( $string ) {
    $regex = "#\bhttps?://[^\s()<>]+(?:\([\w\d]+\)|([^[:punct:]\s]|/))#";
    preg_match_all($regex, $string, $matches);
    return $matches[0][0];
}


but I don't think it's a good idea to get url from the content, If the url contains any complex query strings or any escaped characters, that regx would probably break.

My suggestion would be Custom Fields.



Regards
Sark

}

function add_extra_link_on_single() {
    global $product;
    $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
    $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
     if( $product_type == "simple" ) {
        echo '<a href="domain.com">Visit Site</a>';
    }
}
add_action( 'woocommerce_before_add_to_cart_button', 'add_extra_link_on_single' );

function add_extra_link_on_archive( $html, $product ) {
    $terms        = get_the_terms( $product->id, 'product_type' );
    $product_type = ! empty( $terms ) ? sanitize_title( current( $terms )->name ) : 'simple';
     if( $product_type == "simple" ) {
        return '<a href="domain.com">Visit Site</a>'.$html;
    }
    return $html;
}
add_action( 'woocommerce_loop_add_to_cart_link', 'add_extra_link_on_archive' );

Sark

On Tue, Jun 9, 2015 at 7:55 PM, Sarkware <sark@sarkware.com> wrote:
Removing.? you mean hiding the price right,?.

you can do that using 'woocommerce_get_price_html' hook ( there is no option from the plugin ).

in your 'functions.php' do something like this.

function hide_bundle_price( $price, $product ) {
    if( $product->get_title() == 'You Product Title' ) {
        return "";
    }
    return $price;
}
add_filter( 'woocommerce_get_price_html', 'hide_bundle_price', 2, 10 );


regards
Sark
